subject: AI
title: Knowledge Cutoffs
description: The model's training data has a hard stop date.

hook.text: You ask the model about an event that happened last month. It either says it doesn't know (good) or confidently describes a completely different event (bad).

buildup.text: Every model has a training data cutoff: GPT-4 might have data up to April 2024, Claude up to early 2025. Anything after the cutoff is unknown to the model.

discovery.text: The cutoff isn't always obvious. The model might have outdated information about prices, laws, company names, or APIs that changed after training. It doesn't flag stale data.

twist.text: Web browsing tools give the illusion of current knowledge, but the model's reasoning about the current data still relies on its training knowledge. It might misinterpret current events through an outdated lens.

climax.text: For time-sensitive information: always use live data sources. Note the model's cutoff date and design systems that compensate for stale knowledge.

punchline.text: The model lives in the past. For anything current, bring the data to the model ‚Äî it can't go get it.

quiz.question: How should you handle questions about events after the model's training cutoff?
options: Use live data sources and RAG to provide current information
Tell users the model always has current information
